meanings.definition: A person or organization that supports or promotes a product or service.
meanings.sent1: The endorsors of the new charity event helped raise a lot of money.
meanings.sent2: The company's endorsors shared positive reviews about the new product.
meanings.sent3: The endorsors of the local bakery made everyone crave their delicious pastries.
meanings.sent4: The endorsors were like shining stars guiding customers towards the best deals.
meanings.sent5: The endorsors' enthusiasm was contagious, drawing more people to the cause.

meanings.definition: Those who sign the back of a check to transfer ownership to another party.
meanings.sent1: The endorsors on the check ensured the money reached the right recipient.
meanings.sent2: Make sure all endorsors sign the back of the check before depositing it.
meanings.sent3: The endorsors accidentally used disappearing ink, causing confusion at the bank.
meanings.sent4: The endorsors' signatures were like secret codes unlocking the funds for transfer.
meanings.sent5: The endorsors' names on the check were the key to unlocking the financial transaction.
